title: Longing for the Mud
shortDescription: Undergraduate thesis for Hampshire College, exploring the Quebec diaspora and themes of memory and loss.
longDescription: Combining memoir, translated oral histories and the code to a failed point-and-click adventure game, this 160-page document is a testament to lost migrant history and the pitfalls that come with attempting to "fill in the holes" in memory.

title: Remember the Ember
shortDescription: A 3D interactive narrative based on the oral histories of Quebecois migrants, built in Unity.
longDescription:
This project utilizes archival photography, much of it gathered during my reasearch for Longing for the Mud, as the basis for reacreating the Quebec migrant experience over various stages in an interactive 3D environment. Much of the dialogue and text of the experience comes directly from contemporaneous oral histories.

Please note: This project is still in the planning stages.

I will be regularly updating the "sources" section with links to major resources that are fueling and inspiring this project.

title: COME OVER AND HELP VS
shortDescription: A 2D side-scrolling experience about the King Philip's War, utilizing 17th century woodblock prints, built in Unity.
longDescription:
Drawing heavily on Jill Lepore's The Name of War and on the 17th Century woodblock prints the adorned the pages of so many "captivity narratives" popular at the time, this ongoing project will endeavor to explore the complicated and oft-overlooked history of King Philip's War.

Please note: This project is still in the planning stages.

I will be regularly updating the "sources" section with links to major resources that are fueling and inspiring this project.
